data.title: Average Bakery
data.text: Very sweet, not too flavorful.  I like cinnamon and cardamon and artistically made yeast dough.  The cakes are great.  But here is the rub.  Out of 5 special orders for birthday cakes three of them were wrong, ugh.  Old school could use some updating.

data.title: Frequent flyer
data.text: Our go to place for kid and adult birthday cakes. I have seen some absolutely amazing cakes come home for birthdays over the years - my favorite was a dragon cake. Always of the highest quality too.

data.title: Great Breads, Often busy
data.text:
Pro tip: grab a number immediately on entering so you can browse while you wait your turn.

Try some samples! Everything they make here is fantastic. The desserts are sweet and flavorful. The breads are fresh and interesting. Even their lowly sugar cookies somehow come out better than anything I make at home.

data.title: The best baked goods in Portland
data.text:
I go here about once a week for bread, cookies, cake and other delicious baked goods.

I have not had one thing here that was not absolutely tasty.  I had a napoleon from there that I just finished about 5 minutes ago that actually inspired this review!

data.title: Well deserving Beaverton Institution!
data.text: Beaverton Bakery is a well deserving institution, absolutely fabulous!!! My personal favorites are the Cannoli and Boston Creme Donuts. Their seasonal selections are also great, especially the Apple Cider Donuts. I've bought several cakes over the years, and they have been both very tasty and beautiful.

data.title: Superior--but you pay for it
data.text: This is one of the very last REAL bakeries left west of PDX.  The Perfection Bakery of Hillsboro closed last week.  Admittedly no one needs a bridal cake and a dozen glazed the same week, but you can get them all here and they are real yeast raised quality oil cooked doughnuts.  A huge variety, friendly staff, and quality goods, you get what you pay for.

data.title: great buns in the freezer
data.text: Across the street is Ringo's bar and grill. They use BB's buns for their burgers and the buns really taste great - so we bought some - they keep them in the freezer and are still tasty when we used them at home...almost fresh!

data.title: Moist Moist Moist
data.text: My daughter drags me to every cupcake place across America. New York to New Orleans, Seattle to San Diego and I'd put Beaverton Bakery at the top. Their cupcakes are so moist and the frosting is delicious.

data.title: Try a different bakery!
data.text:
I'm honestly not sure why people love this place so much. They are over rated. Not only are the baked goods mediocre (over the years, I have always have that opinion.. even after trying them several times over the last year thinking they had an off day and giving the benefit of the doubt.) ALSO, I know first hand that they treat their employees terribly!!!!! 
Try a different bakery.

data.title: Great Local Bakery
data.text: I've been buying baked goods here for more than 30 years. Good quality ingredients and helpful staff. They did my wedding cake some 28 years ago. I now take my grandson here for cookies. Not cheap, but worth it.
